subject: VAM Support
description_text:
Good day.  I recently acquired a set of VAM Haptics for my pro x pedals.
They briefly worked and have since stopped.  They were working up to the
point I installed an external sound amp connected to the motherboard
sound.  I have validated the proper 24v DC coming from the power supply.  I
have also swapped USB cables and ports.  The pedals are working fine. Only
the VAM Haptics are not.  Can you please provide some troubleshooting
assistance?  Thank You.

I am using the 2.10 Simsonn configuration application.

Kind Regards,
J. Sheldon

conversations.body_text: Hi Joe S.,      Please provide your order number and let us know how many VAM units are damaged. Have you tried swapping the VAMs for testing? At the same time, please record a video showing the vibration test interface in Simsonn Manager. Once completed, kindly share the video with us via Google Drive and make sure to grant access permissions.

Thank you.   I was given this as a gift delivered from Amazon and don't
have an order number as no gift receipt was provided.  I received them
roughly 10 days ago.   I have the set of three but only have the throttle
and brake.   I did swap the devices and get the same result, no activation.
  All three do not work.

The video was shared from my wbijms2024@gmail.com account.  I think you can
also click this link.

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1yhzVWi0f3bFjnYUX-ZL5-pDZYrYP0Gpp/view?usp=drivesdk



Kind Regards,
J Sheldon

On Fri, Sep 19, 2025 at 23:17 support@simsonn.com
Hi Joe S.,  Hello, please adjust the video access permissions so that I can review it and further check the issue.

I just changed the permissions.  You should now be able to access the
video.
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1yhzVWi0f3bFjnYUX-ZL5-pDZYrYP0Gpp/view?usp=drivesdk

Thank you

J Sheldon
On Sun, Sep 21, 2025 at 06:35 support@simsonn.com

Checking in to ensure you have received the video.

Best Regards,
J Sheldon

Hi Joe S.,  Please provide your contact person, phone number, and address, and we will send you 3 new VAM units. We will soon update the VAM algorithm, making the vibration stronger while ensuring it will not be damaged by prolonged or high-intensity use.

Thank you.  I actually don't think it is the VAM as I had the 3rd unused
VAM (for the clutch) that i swapped in with the same result.  No vibration.
  Do you think it could be the controller?

None the less, contact information is below.   Much appreciate your
support.

Joseph Sheldon +1 980 231 1614
196 South San Agustin Drive
Mooresville,NC 28117 USA

Best Regards,
J Sheldon

On Wed, Sep 24, 2025 at 11:33 support@simsonn.com

Hi Joe S.,  Please use SIMSONN Manager 2.1.1 for this new board, as it allows you to set the VAM type. Make sure to uninstall version 2.1.0 on your computer first to avoid conflicts when opening the software. Then, in version 2.1.1, go to Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → Pedals and select the plusx.sfu file I attached. After the update, please retest the vibration function.      https://drive.google.com/file/d/1aX1xWqdWBx5tM-Mzmgxk0FIUBqTixmnM/view?usp=drive_link

I have followed the steps provided; removing v2.1.0, installing v2.1.1,
updated the firmware with the attached .sfu file and retested.  I am
getting the same result; no vibration output.  New video  uploaded.

IMG_0047.MOV - Google Drive
<https://drive.google.com/file/d/127a4oZnfXP4cYN8vDOXvtlKGvR0jc0U6/view>

Kinds Regards,
J Sheldon

On Wed, Sep 24, 2025 at 11:53 AM support@simsonn.com

Hi Joe S.,     I see that it shows CPU2 not connected. Please disconnect both the USB and power cables, then reconnect the USB first, wait a few seconds, and then plug in the vibration motor power to see if it restores the display to CPU1: 2.0.5  CPU2: 2.0.3. If it does, please test again; if not, please install ToDesk software so that I can remotely assist you in checking the upgrade issue.      https://www.todesk.com/download.html

Both seem to be connected now...

[image: image.png]

On Wed, Sep 24, 2025 at 5:47 PM support@simsonn.com
Hi Joe S.,    You can test the vibration function, but please make sure to select the correct vibration motor type first.

they are the VAM devices.   I have selected rhem and I ran the test, still
no vibration.

On Wed, Sep 24, 2025 at 21:03 support@simsonn.com
Hi Joe S.,    Do you have time now? Please install the ToDesk software so I can check the issue remotely.  https://dl.todesk.com/windows/ToDesk_Setup.exe

I'm sorry.  I don't have time now as there would be several network changes
I would have to make to open up remote desktop services.   Are there any
other options?

On Wed, Sep 24, 2025 at 21:35 support@simsonn.com
Hi Joe S., Could you advise whether we should send a replacement PlusX control box or a new VAM motor? Alternatively, we could schedule a new time for remote assistance.

I believe it may be the control box.  I applied 12v DC to the spare motor I
have is it vibrated just fine.  If you could forward a control box, I would
be most grateful.  Thank you.

On Wed, Sep 24, 2025 at 6:51 PM support@simsonn.com

Hi Joe S.,  Please provide the contact person, phone number, address, and order number, so I can send you a new control box today. Also, could you let me know how you tested it with 12V and provide a photo of the test? Thank you very much.

Sure.  I can get a video of the test tomorrow.   I simply connected an
external 12v DC power supply directly to the motor on my test bench via a
matching female barrel connector.  As soon as I switch on the 12v power,
the motor vibrated.

Joe Sheldon
196 South San Agustin Drive
Mooresville, NC 28117

(980)231-1614

Thank you for your consideration and courtesy to work through this.



On Wed, Sep 24, 2025 at 22:09 support@simsonn.com
Hi Joe S.,  Here is the tracking number : SF6045933999580. You can track it via https://www.sf-international.com/cn/en/support/querySupport/waybill

Thank you.   As prokosed, attached is the method and tools I used to test
the motor.



On Thu, Sep 25, 2025 at 06:05 support@simsonn.com

Hello.

New development.  I plugged in the spare motor into the controller that I
had tested using the method in the previous email and it worked.  At this
point, the controller is confirmed good and the two motors are.confirmed as
bad.  Any chance you can.hold the shipment on the controller and send me
two replacement motors.

Kind regards
J Sheldon
Hi Joe S.,     No problem. I’ll arrange for our operations team to send you two replacement VAM units. I’ll share the tracking number with you tomorrow.

Thank you very much.

On Sat, Sep 27, 2025 at 09:17 support@simsonn.com
